summary: Centrus Energy jumped 8.8% through 3:15 p.m. ET Wednesday on (potentially) terrific news for thenuclear power industry . Amazon (and Meta Platforms) are going full speed ahead in setting up new data centers for artificial intelligence (AI) Centrus helps to enrich the uranium that fuels those nuclear power plants .  Amazon is building data centers in North Carolina to support its own AI infrastructure . Amazon could spend $100 billion this year on capital improvements in general, AI infrastructure in particular . If AI is growing, then the need for nuclear power plants to fuel that growth -- and for enriched uranium -- will grow as well . Reddit says it has used the social media company’s content without permission to train its AI models . The lawsuit alleges that Anthropic attempted to access Reddit data more than 100,000 times since last July . Anthropic says it disagrees with Reddit's claims and will “defend ourselves vigorously”  The AI startup Anthropic “bills itself as the white knight of the AI industry,” Reddit said in the lawsuit . The social media platform called Anthropic’s emphasis on trust and honesty “empty marketing gimmicks”  This suit is among a flurry of high-profile complaints against AI companies including Meta Platforms Inc. and OpenAI . Reddit would prefer to reach an agreement outside of court, Lee said .  Trump Considers Deporting Migrants to Rwanda after the UK Decides Not to . Trump considers deporting Migrants from the UK to Rwanda, but UK decides not to .

J.P. Morgan raised its price target on Meta Platforms to $735 a share . Analyst says Meta has "virtual ownership" of the social media space and provides "significant value to advertisers" The bigger question is whether Meta's high stock price offers value .  J.P. Morgan seemed to deemphasize Meta stock's high price relative to its growth prospects . Priced north of 26 times trailing earnings, Meta stock simply costs too much for the 14% long-term earnings growth rate Wall Street projects for it over the next five years . While it's certainly possible Meta will outperform expectations and grow faster, at $1.7trillionin market cap, Meta is pretty gigantic already .  Meta Platforms wasn’t one of The Motley Fool’s top 10 best stocks for investors to buy now . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $656,825!  The Motley Fool has invested in Meta Platforms . Rich Smith is a member of the board of directors . He has a long-term stake in the company, which is based in the U.S.

Meta Platforms rose 2% after JPMorgan raised its price target to $735 from $675 . JPMorgan's analysts cited Meta's dominantsocial-media position and strategic investments in long-term AI as drivers of upside . JPMorgan forecasts robust revenue and EPS growth through 2026 .  Investors should care because the higher target reflects confidence that Meta's AI investments and core ad business can sustain margins and earnings growth, even amid heavy infrastructure spending .

We recently published a list of10 AI Stocks on Wall Street’s Radar . In this article, we are going to take a look at where Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) stands against other AI stocks .  Meta Platforms, Inc. is a global technology company . It is highly confident in the company’s potential for growth as it ramps up the use of the said technology .

Meta Platform experienced a price increase of nearly 12% over the past month . The recent power purchase agreement with Constellation for nuclear energy positions Meta Platforms to potentially stabilize operational costs . The declaration of a quarterly dividend and addressing shareholder proposals present stable financial and governance strategies .  Over the past three years, Meta's total shareholder return, including share price and dividends, was 242.44% . This remarkable growth reflects its ability to outperform the broader US market and Interactive Media and Services industry . The recent dividend announcement could solidify investor confidence, potentially supporting the share price .  Meta Platforms is within 6.74% of the consensus analyst price target of US$703.89, indicating potential upside if growth forecasts materialize . Investors should assess if these strategic initiatives can sustain long-term rewards .  This article was originally published bySimply Wall St. Have you got in touch with the editor of this article? Contact us atsimplywallst.com or email editorial@mailonline.com .

Shareholder proposals asking Microsoft and Meta to assess Bitcoin for corporate treasuries rejected by over 99% of voters . Both companies' boards opposed the proposals, claiming they already review all cash management options including cryptocurrencies . The Bitcoin platform has earned some Street cred in recent years .  Thesespot Bitcoin fundshave nearly $121 billion of digital assets under management in June 2025 . Some of the most significant buys of these ETFs come from old-school financial giants such as Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley .  Bitcoin-based investments used to be pure high-risk ideas, with sky-high beta values indicating massive volatility . Low beta values signify below-average price swings, while negative ones belong to investments that often move in direct opposition to the stock market .  Activist investors have been asking some of the world's largest tech titans to buy some Bitcoin . Two different groups asked Microsoft and Meta Platforms to just look into the idea . Both companies opposed these proposals . Microsoft's board recommended shareholders to vote against the measure .  Microsoft shareholders voted on Bitcoin proposals on their proxy statements . The Bitcoin proposal received just 0.55% "yea" approval . The top performers got more than 30% approval ratings, but Bitcoin was barely there .  Some investors may simply be satisfied with the ordinary review of financial management options . At the same time, there's some truth to the anti-Bitcoin sentiment seen in these lopsided votes . The vast majority of Microsoft and Meta Platforms shares are held by institutional investors . JPMorgan unveiled a slate of top internet stocks, including Amazon, Meta, and Alphabet . Others to earn a shoutout included Spotify, eBay, Etsy, Duolingo, and Booking . The bank raised its price targets for companies across the sector as trade war concerns have abated in recent weeks .  Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp parent could deliver revenue growth in the low teens in 2025 and 2026, JPMorgan says . The company moved its price target to $240 from $225, which implies 17% upside over Amazon's price . Google owner Alphabet was also listed among JPMorgan's top internet picks .  The music streaming giant is expected to see low-mid teens revenue growth driven by its premium subscriber base . eBay and Etsy should each benefit from China tariff relief, JPMorgan said .

Citi downgrades Constellation Energy shares to Neutral from Buy . Analyst cites limited near-term upside following recent rally and announcement of PPA with Meta . The energy firm’s shares fell 2.6% in premarket trading on Wednesday by 08:21 GMT .  Analyst Levine raised the price target on Constellation Energy shares to $318 from $232 . Levine sees a “balanced risk to the upside and the downside” for CEG . Levine maintains a High Risk classification on the stock due to volatility . Constellation Energy shares slip as Citi lowers rating on limited upside potential .

Needham downgraded the stock to hold from buy, making it the latest firm to turn more cautious . Analyst Laura Martin sees a number of risks, including competition and tepid growth trends . Apple shares fell 0.6% in premarket trading . The stock is down 19% this year as of its last close .  Needham is the latest firm to sour on Apple this year . Needham says it doesn't see an iPhone replacement cycle in the next 12 months . Apple is seen as especially vulnerable to tariffs and its struggles with AI have been another headwind .  fewer than 60% of the analysts tracked by Bloomberg recommend buying the stock, a low rate among megacaps . Microsoft Corp., Amazon.com Inc., Nvidia Corp., and Meta Platforms Inc. are have buy ratios near or above 90%.

Meta Platforms is working to enable brands to fully automate the creation and targeting of advertisements using AI by the end of 2026 . Currently, Meta’s ad platform provides AI tools that generate variations of existing ads and make minor adjustments for targeting on Facebook and Instagram .  In 2024, advertising accounted for more than 97% of Meta’s total revenue, funding its investments in AI infrastructure, including chips, data centres, and model training . Zuckerberg: “In the not-too-distant future, we want to get to a world where any business will be able to just tell us what objective they’re trying to achieve, like selling something or getting a new customer, and connect their bank account and then we just do the rest for them”  In April 2025, Meta initiatedlayoffs in its Reality Labs division, impacting employees in Oculus Studios and hardware teams . Meta looking to fully automate ad creation by 2026-end – report .

Spotify stock is up 50% year to date, making it one of the top-performing stocks so far in 2025 . Over the last three years, Spotify is up more than 477% . This social media giant boasts some of the best fundamentals within the tech sector .  Spotify boasts a strong competitive moat . By creating personalized playlists and honing its suggestions based on its users' likes and dislikes, Spotify gives its customers what they want when they want it . With over 675 million monthly average users, Spotify benefits from a significant network effect .  Spotify has produced several quarters of net income in the $200 million to $300 million range . Over the last 12 months, Spotify's net income stands at $1.3 billion . The company generates a staggering $170 billion in annual revenue .  Statista estimates that by 2030, fully 80% of all advertising will be digital . That would represent an increasein digital ad spending of roughly 50% over the next five years . Second, Meta is a leading artificial intelligence (AI) company, too .  Meta Platforms bought back more than $13 billion of its own stock, reducing its overall share count and boosting the price of outstanding shares . To sum up, Meta's business model is firing on all cylinders and its stock boasts excellent fundamentals . Investors looking for a strong tech stock with fantastic prospects should strongly consider Meta . Randi Zuckerberg, a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors .

Meta Platforms is generating strong growth as its AI capabilities boost advertising revenue . The company delivered an impressive Q1, helping to brush aside market concerns about a shifting economy . The stock's several advantages relative to its "Magnificent Seven" peers may help it outperform in the second half of 2025 .  Meta Platforms distinguishes itself through pioneering innovation in social media, with over 3.4 billion monthly active users across its ecosystem, including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp . Unlike hyperscalers likeMicrosoftandAmazon, whose AI strategies depend on selling cloud-based AI services to external clients, Meta's strength lies in directly applying its AI models to enhance its core advertising business .  In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 16% year over year . Net income soared 35% to a record $16.6 billion, or $6.43 in earnings per share . Despite higher AI investment, Meta generated $10.3 billion in free cash flow . Wall Street analysts anticipate 14% revenue growth for 2025 and 2026 .  Meta Platforms stands out as a top AI stock because of its attractive valuation . With a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 25, Meta trades at a large discount to its Magnificent Seven peers .  Meta Platforms stock is a great option for investors seeking to build a diversified portfolio with exposure to high-level themes in technology and AI . While internet giantAlphabetis the exception, trading at a forward P/E of 18, it faces significant regulatory scrutiny . Meta Platforms is signing a 20-year deal to buy nuclear power from Constellation Energy . The deal will extend the life of Constellation's Clinton Clean Energy Center for two more decades .  Meta Platforms is signing a 20-year PPA for the entire output of Constellation's Clinton Clean Energy Center -- 1,121 megawatts . The deal begins in June 2027 and will support the relicensing of this nuclear energyfacility .  Meta's deal with Constellation Energy likely won't be its last nuclear power deal . The Clinton Clean Energy Center has been at risk of being shut down . Meta says it's in final discussions with a short list of other potential projects .  Meta's agreement to buy all the power produced from that plant will extend its economic life for another two decades . Last year, Microsoft signed a 20-year PPA for 100% of the capacity of the company's Crane Clean Energy Center . Growing demand for nuclear energy from technology companies is helping power a surge in Constellation Energy's earnings .  Meta Platforms is a game-changing technology that could significantly increase productivity . Constellation Energy is an interesting way to invest in the AI megatrend alongside companies like Meta and Microsoft . EssilorLuxottica is a colossus shaping the vision of billions around the world . Yet its veritable presence hides in plain sight, underscoring that there’s so much more to it than meets the eye .  EssilorLuxottica controls 25% of the eyewear market . It reported €26.5 billion in revenue last year and has a market capitalization of €112 billion . The company’s roots go back to 1849, when it was founded in Paris .  Luxottica was founded in 1961 by Leonardo Del Vecchio in Agordo, Italy, to make components for the optical industry . The company was listed on the New York Stock Exchange in 1990 (and in Milan in 2000)  Essilor and Luxottica had become the world’s largest suppliers of prescription lenses and eyewear, respectively . The two also had near-equal and vast market shares of 13% and 14% in the eyewearing space .  The Franco-Italian company operates in the complex convergence of eye care, fashion eyewear, and medical technology . It invests as much as €350 million in R&D annually and is chasing deals that will make its products even more critical to how people experience the world .  EssilorLuxottica secured its omnipresence in the world today by masterfully capturing every segment of the eyewear value chain . The self-made entrepreneur traced a stunning rags-to-riches story: He started working at age 14 as an apprentice to a metal engraver .  Luxottica learned to master vertical integration, not just for its own suite of products, but for the entire eyewear and eye care industry . Being vertically integrated fueled a virtuous cycle that made the company boom . “If I had to sum up how successful the business model is, really, 90% comes from vertical integration," says Cédric Rossi .  The mystery behind markups on eyeglasses has long chased the industry, with some speculating they can soar as high as 1,000% . Houlihan Lokey estimates gross margins on prescription eyewear are upwards of 65% .  Luxottica became virtually inescapable for customers seeking eyewear . The stores put the company at the intersection of demand and supply by connecting people to optometrists . Another example of how vertical integration helped the company was in rejiggering Ray-Ban’s appeal .  Ray-Ban is EssilorLuxottica’s crown jewel and the vessel for some of its breakthrough wearable innovations . The iconic sunglasses were sported by Audrey Hepburn inBreakfast at Tiffany’sand Tom Cruise in Top Gun .  At the center of EssilorLuxottica’s existence is its research focus, which has yielded over 15,000 patents . The company works with a network of researchers, engineers, and designers who help address vision impairments .  EssilorLuxottica sees myopia as one of the “biggest threats facing health care.” More than half the world’s population is projected to suffer from nearsightedness by 2050 . The company developed the Stellest lenses, which can slow myopia progression by 67% .  Demand for myopia management spectacles and contact lenses has risen at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 31% and 13% in the past five years . EssilorLuxottica’s OneSight Foundation has undertaken to eradicate uncorrected poor visionby 2050 .  In late 2024, EssilorLuxottica confirmed a long-term agreement with Metato create “multigenerational smart eyewear” Other tech companies, including Google, have tried to crack the wearable eye tech market .  Merging Essilor and Luxottica had been “a lifelong dream” for founder Del Vecchio . Dealmaking savvy has been the greatest enabler of both companies' individual histories .  EssilorLuxottica bought Nuance Hearing in 2023 to fight the stigma surrounding hearing aids and embed audio enhancement tools into eyeglasses . In the past six months, the Paris-headquartered giant has bought ophthalmology group Optegra, AI audio startup Pulse Audition, noninvasive medical device company Espansione Group, and retinal imaging startup Cellview .  In 2019, EssilorLuxottica announced a bid for GrandVision, which owned a network of over 7,000 stores globally . Regulators green-lit the €7 billion deal in 2021 on the condition that the eyewear giant sell its own brand .  EssilorLuxottica floated the idea of acquisitions to grow its production capabilities in the U.S. if tariffs were to kick in . CEO Millerisaid he won’t rush a decision . For now, the company will increase prices in the American market to offset the levies .  EssilorLuxottica has reported five years of sales growth, barring 2020, when the pandemic hit . The company’s shares have risen about 20% in the past year . Del Vecchio died in 2022 at the age of 87, following the family behind the hazelnut-flavored chocolates Ferrero Rocher .  EssilorLuxottica won’t have a straightforward path ahead . It will have to contend with the likes of Warby Parker, which went public in 2021 . It’s diversified enough to be up to the challenges of the future .  Kering Eyewear, a division within the broader luxury conglomerate,partnered withGoogle in late May to make AI-powered glasses . In a 2024 report, the company acknowledged that the need for optical products will continue to grow .  U.S. consumers are consumers worldwide, according to CNN.com . The company is focused on its focus on women and minorities in the United States and Canada .
Meta has cut a 20-year deal to secure nuclear power to help meet demand for artificial intelligence and other computing needs at Facebook’s parent company .

Alphabet and Meta Platforms trade at very attractive valuations, especially when you consider their fundamental strengths . Alphabet revealed 100 new announcements, most of them related to artificial intelligence (AI) at its annual Google I/O developer conference . According to Mark Zuckerberg, Meta AI has now amassed 1 billion monthly active users .  Alphabet has had AI at the forefront of its strategy for about a decade . It continues to release new versions of itsGemini large language models . At its recent I/O developer conference, the company introduced numerous new AI-related features across the business .  Mark Zuckerberg's Meta AI assistant has now reached 1 billion monthly active users . With 3.43 billion daily active users, Meta is in the same ballpark as Alphabet in terms of a massive user base . As of March 31, it had $95 billion of cash, cash, equivalents, and marketable securities .  Meta had $70 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities on the books at the end of Q1 . It generated $17 billion in net income during the quarter . Management plans to spend $68 billion (at the midpoint) this year to bolster its tech infrastructure .  These two companies are the cheapest of the "Magnificent Seven" grouping . In my opinion, investors don't need to pick just one of these dominant businesses . I see no reason why both of these AI stocks can't be bought today .  Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg's sister Randi Zuckerberg is a former Facebook spokeswoman .
